sentences: Mida rohkem vaatad, seda rohkem küsimusi idub.
context: The word 'vaatad' is the 2nd person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'vaadata', which means 'to look at', 'to watch', or 'to observe'. It's used when speaking directly to someone (you) about what they are currently looking at, watching, or considering. The dictionary definition shows it in context with the phrase 'Mida rohkem vaatad, seda rohkem küsimusi idub' which means 'The more you look/watch, the more questions arise'.
